name: Erdős #10: Prime Plus Powers of 2
description: Is there some constant k such that every integer can be expressed as the sum of a prime and at most k powers of 2?

insights: Romanoff (1934): Positive density of integers are p + 2^k
Gallagher (1975): For any ε > 0, ∃ k(ε) with density ≥ 1-ε
Granville-Soundararajan (1998): Conjecture k=3 for odd, k=4 for even
Grechuk counterexample: 1,117,175,146 cannot be p + (≤3 powers of 2)
Erdős called this 'probably unattackable' - expected answer is NO universal k exists
DeepMind has formalized the statement in their formal-conjectures repo
262 is the smallest composite n that cannot be written as p + 2^a (k=1 counterexample)
128 is the smallest n>3 that cannot be p + 2^a + 2^b (k=2 counterexample, OEIS A006286)
Crocker (1971): Proved infinitely many odd numbers not representable as p + 2^a + 2^b
OEIS A006285: de Polignac numbers (odd, k=1 failures): 127, 149, 251, 331, ...
OEIS A006286: Numbers not p + 2^x + 2^y (k=2 failures): 128, 150, 252, ...
builtItems: Small case witnesses for n=3-10 at Erdos10PrimePlusPowers.lean:85-113 (PROVED)
mathlibGaps: No asymptotic/natural density formalization in Mathlib
Romanoff's theorem would require analytic number theory infrastructure
No direct support for 'frequently at infinity' proofs about representations
nextSteps: Prove axioms computationally or connect to decidable primality checking
Explore Crocker's covering congruence construction for infinite family
Find smallest k=4 counterexample (likely very large)
knowledge.progressSummary: PROGRESS: Proved k_one_insufficient, added k=2 counterexample (128), proved k_two_insufficient, proved k_three_insufficient. first_three_k_insufficient summarizes pattern.

sessions.summary: Created Erdos10PrimePlusPowers.lean (~200 lines). Defined IsPrimePlus2Pow, IsPrimePlusKPowers. Proved small cases n=3-10 as p+2^a. Stated Romanoff/Gallagher as axioms. Formalized erdos_10_positive/negative conjectures. Documented Grechuk counterexample.
Added k=1 counterexample: 262 cannot be p + 2^a. Proved counterexample_k1_not_prime. Added k_one_insufficient theorem (1 sorry for multiset reasoning).

Completed k_one_insufficient proof (multiset case analysis). Added k=2 counterexample: 128 (from OEIS A006286). Proved k_two_insufficient. Added k_three_insufficient using Grechuk. Proved first_three_k_insufficient summary theorem. Discovered Crocker (1971) result.
